reviews.text: it’s almost impossible to recommend this over the other two games
any character created can’t be deleted later...may have something to do with the game’s battle pass
the story...doesn’t give you enough context...no way to look back on story events
the game’s oil panting aesthetic...doesn’t look good
NPCs bear no actual purpose outside of giving context to story bits
missions themselves are horrendously bland...linear pathways
jumping...terribly floaty...air dash...hopelessly short
equipment enhancement locked until way too far into the story
combat...decent ideas...weapons...interchangeably
combat...runs out of reasons to make you care
Quick Match is nice for completing missions with a group
cookie cutter levels...no exploration...tedious journey
graphics don’t make the game...Babylon’s Fall has none of that
crafting gear...unlocked too late
no sense of identity...poor comparison to free games
Skirmishes don’t provide much more non-story missions that might be easier to quick match into
You just gain XP as you go without any explanation or visible XP bar
Character design is awful and leaves everyone devoid of expression
Combat turns into using only swords for Spectral Attacks as their Spirit Siphon and damage are high enough
no pop-up tutorial explaining any of this so you have to figure it out on your own
assuming it survives this rocky launch, there’s enough potential to maybe transform it into something much better in the future
Babylon’s Fall is a live-service game, assuming it survives this rocky launch
